articles.author: Neal Fennimore
articles.description:
These things called passkeys sure are making the rounds these days. They were a main attraction at W3C TPAC 2022, gained support in Safari 16, are finding their way into macOS and iOS, and are slated to …
Passkeys: What the Heck and Why? originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Passkeys: What the Heck and Why?

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Marcus Herrmann)
articles.description: In this piece, a Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) auditor shares some cookie banner error patterns that can massively hurt a page’s overall conformance. Let’s explore what to look out for with this omnipresent piece of the web interface.
articles.title: The Potentially Dangerous Non-Accessibility Of Cookie Notices

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sarah Oke Okolo)
articles.description: In this article, Sarah Oke Okolo explores the importance of Web Workers for multithreading on the web, including the limitations and considerations of using them and the strategies for mitigating potential issues associated with them.
articles.title: Exploring The Potential Of Web Workers For Multithreading On The Web

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tejas Kumar)
articles.description: Dockerizing your Node.js apps can lead to smashing success—offering consistency, easy debugging, and hassle-free dependency management. When you host this container on Kinsta, you also benefit from high-speed performance, robust security, and top-notch scalability. By combining these two, you'll surely have a whale of a time as you sail smoothly through the development seas.
articles.title: Building And Dockerizing A Node.js App With Stateless Architecture With Help From Kinsta

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adel Khamatov)
articles.description: In this article, Adel Khamatov shares a model of color mechanics that he came up with during research on developing UI kits and illustrates an approach to solving related problems with best practices.
articles.title: Color Mechanics In UI Kits

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode of The Smashing Podcast, we take a look at design storytelling. What is it, and how can it help us shape digital experiences? Vitaly talks to Chiara Aliotta to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 59 With Chiara Aliotta: What Is Design Storytelling?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Krithika Subramanian)
articles.description: Have you ever wondered if things could have been done differently? But not sure how? Well, then, do not fall in love with the solution, but fall in love with the problem! Here’s an article to dive deep into how design thinking could do just that.
articles.title: What Is Design Thinking?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Suzanne Scacca)
articles.description: If you want to maximize conversions or collect necessary user information for other purposes, a user onboarding flow is necessary. In this article, you will learn how, with the help of Feathery, to design an effective user onboarding flow for your app.
articles.title: How To Design An Effective User Onboarding Flow

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Zack Grossbart & Terry Yao)
articles.description: If you are a developer who wants to concentrate on delivering a killer application rather than worrying about countless security issues, threat model documents can help you do that. With small architectural changes, we can make these threats manageable and prevent them in the future.
articles.title: How To Protect Your App With A Threat Model Based On JSONDiff

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lyndon Cerejo)
articles.description: This article highlights non-technical skills like curiosity, observation, empathy, advocacy, visual communication, and collaboration that designers routinely use in their process to make a difference through design. AI can be used to augment designers’ workflow instead of replacing people.
articles.title: Beyond Algorithms: Skills Of Designers That AI Can’t Replicate

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: With April just around the corner, we have a new collection of desktop and mobile wallpapers waiting for you to celebrate the beginning of the new month. Designed by creatives from all across the globe, the wallpapers come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: Swing Into April (2023 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Slava Shestopalov)
articles.description: Workshops are all about people: they involve people, are conducted by people, and aim to close the gaps in people’s communication. Slava Shestopalov shares a checklist with everything you need to keep in mind when running a workshop.
articles.title: A Comprehensive Checklist For Running Design Workshops

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Dealing with sensitive data is an important topic for any app. In this article, you will find out how to handle sensitive or confidential information in your apps and what Row-Level Security means.
articles.title: Fine-Grained Access Handling And Data Management With Row-Level Security

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Design handoffs are inefficient and painful. They cause frustration, friction and a lot of back and forth. Can we avoid them altogether? Of course we can! Let’s see how to do just that.
articles.title: The Best Handoff Is No Handoff

articles.author: Shittu Olumide
articles.description: These days, many people are concerned with the way AI is evolving. They see it effortlessly solving problems, performing tasks quickly and accurately, and doing jobs easily and efficiently.  And while some people are scared, others are actually embracing it. I'm one of those people who are embracing it,
articles.title: How to Use ChatGPT – Prompts for Data Scientists

articles.author: Scott Gary
articles.description: The concept of Server Side Rendering (SSR) is often misunderstood. So my aim in this article is to bring clarity to this process and how it works.  Here's what we'll cover in this guide:  1. What is server side rendering? What are its pros and cons when compared
articles.title: Server Side Rendering in JavaScript – SSR vs CSR Explained

articles.author: Brian Barrow
articles.description: Coming from a language like JavaScript, pointers can be kind of confusing at first. Here I will break it down so that they are easier to understand. What Are Pointers in Go? Just like in JavaScript, Go has variables which are locations in memory that store a value.  In
articles.title: What are Pointers in Go? A Guide for JavaScript Devs

articles.author: Alberto Gonzalez Rosales
articles.description: I've been a competitive programmer for many years. And during that time, I have faced the process of debugging on numerous occasions.  In this article, I will try to describe how debugging works in such environments, instead of depicting it in the regular software development activities we do every
articles.title: How to Debug Your Code Like a Competitive Programmer –Automate and Save Time

articles.author: Quincy Oghenetejiri Ukumakube
articles.description: State management is one of the most important things you'll deal with in front end development.  You can manage state in React in various ways. Some examples include using state in class components, using React hooks such as useState and useEffect hook, using the Context API, or using Redux.
articles.title: How to Use Redux Toolkit to Manage State in Your React Application

articles.author: Eamonn Cottrell
articles.description: Spreadsheets are great for financial modeling, but they're also capable of displaying pixel art.  In this Apps Script tutorial, we'll build a paint by numbers spreadsheet using conditional formatting and a script that "paints" a blank spreadsheet. You'll learn how to:  1. Import data  2. Apply proper
articles.title: Learn Google Apps Script – Build a Paint By Numbers Spreadsheet

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: React Router is a powerful library that helps you build single-page applications with ease. It allows you to create multiple routes, nested routes, and handle transitions between them, all while maintaining a clean and organized codebase. We just published a course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you
articles.title: Learn React Router 6 in Ten Hours

articles.author: Ijeoma Igboagu
articles.description: Do you ever find yourself stuck when it comes to writing or unable to come up with creative solutions to a problem? Don’t worry—you are not alone. Everyone experiences writer's block or a lack of creativity at some point. At times, as writers, we may be really eager to write
articles.title: How to Boost Your Creativity – Strategies for Generating Ideas and Overcoming Writer's Block

articles.author: Gursimar Singh
articles.description: This article is a comprehensive guide on how to read the contents of your computer's RAM.  Random Access Memory (RAM) is a crucial component of any computer system, and it is responsible for temporarily storing data that is required by the system to carry out its functions. But the
articles.title: What is RAM? How to Access Your Computer's RAM and Read the Contents

articles.author: MENE-EJEGI OGBEMI
articles.description: SEE [https://tv.apple.com/us/show/see/umc.cmc.3s4mgg2y7h95fks9gnc4pw13m] is a beautiful Apple TV series that depicts a dystopia where humans have lost their sight.
